title: Amid Yemen - Israel escalation , Hezbollah increases attacks on Israel
message:
(IDF photo)Hezbollah carried out a wave of rocket and drone attacks on Israel from Lebanon on July 20 and July 21.
Israel retaliated on July 21 with a series of airstrikes on the Yemen port of Al Hudaydah and other targets.
Hezbollah, which Iran backs, did not say recently increased attacks on Israel were linked to the strikes in Yemen, but the escalation came as Yemen’s Houthis also vowed to continue attacks on Israel.
Hezbollah claimed, via the pro-Iranian Al-Mayadeen media, that it had carried out wide-ranging attacks on numerous targets in northern Israel, including IDF sites at Zarit, Hanita, and Kibbutz Dafna.
The retaliatory actions so far appear in line with the types of strikes Israel has carried out for nine months in response to Hezbollah.
event_breakdown: IDF sites at Zarit, Hanita, and Kibbutz Dafna were attacked by Hezbollah on July 20 and July 21 from Lebanon. In addition, Israel retaliated for these attacks on July 21 with a series of airstrikes on the Yemen port of Al Hudaydah. As Hezbollah has vowed that it will continue their attacks on Israel, it is anyone's guess where the group may strike next.

title: Two Lebanese Soldiers Injured In Israeli Strike On Watchtower
message:
(MENAFN- Nam News Network) BEIRUT, Jul 22 (NNN-NNA) – Two Lebanese were yesterday, in an Israeli attack targeting a watchtower, in the south-western border region, according to the Lebanese military.
The Lebanese Command reported that, the Israeli strike hit the army watchtower, located outside the village of Alma al-Shaab.
Meanwhile, military sources said that, an Israeli Merkava tank fired a shell directly at the watchtower.
The Lebanese Army Command has requested the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (UNIFIL) to conduct a field investigation into the incident.
The Lebanese militant group also reported attacks on the Israeli Northern Corps command headquarters, at Ein Zeitim and on soldiers in Hanita, an Israeli kibbutz, with Katyusha rockets, resulting in casualties.– NNN-NNA

title: Two U . S . B - 52 Bombers Make Historic First Deployment To Romania
message:
On their way to Romania, the two strategic bombers were intercepted by Russian MiG-31 and MiG-29 aircraft.
h/t @SirListenalot @johnspectator pic.twitter.com/eIL20DCroZ — Hans Kristensen (@nukestrat) July 21, 2024In fact, the B-52s were escorted by Finnish Air Force F/A-18C Hornets and German Air Force Eurofighters over the Gulf of Finland.

title: What are DMZ loudspeaker broadcasts for ?
message:
A worker dismantles loudspeakers set up for propaganda broadcasts near the demilitarized zone in Paju, South Korea, on May 1, 2018.
(AP-Yonhap)South Korea entered its second day of renewed loudspeaker broadcasts along its border with North Korea on Monday, a retaliatory response to Pyongyang's recent barrage of trash-laden balloons sent southward.
Following North Korea's introduction of border loudspeakers in 1962, both countries have embraced the tactic as part of their propaganda campaign.
This practice continued until 2018, when both sides agreed to suspend and remove the speakers during a brief détente under South Korea's previous liberal government.
Hwang Ji-hwan, a professor of International Relations at the University of Seoul, characterizes the loudspeaker broadcasts as a "low-level measure" in response to North Korea's provocations.
event_breakdown:
North Korea fires short-range missiles into waters off eastern coast
South Korea starts broadcasting anti-North Korean propaganda from border loudspeakers

title: Russo - Ukraine War - 21 July 2024

title: Israel extends closure of Al Jazeera bureau for 45 additional days in third such decision
message:
The Israeli government has extended the closure of Al Jazeera’s bureau in Jerusalem and banned its broadcast in Israel for 45 additional days for the third time since the initial decision was implemented in May.
The law, which specifically targets Al Jazeera, enables the Israeli government to shut down foreign media networks for 45 days and renew the ban for an additional period of 45 days.
Al Jazeera had condemned the Israeli decision and described it as “a criminal act” that violates the access to information.
The world first witnessed this on October 25, 2023, when Israel killed four members of prominent Al Jazeera journalist and Gaza bureau chief Wael Dahdouh’s family.
In May 2022, Israel killed prominent Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh as she was covering an Israeli raid in Jenin.

title: 2 Lebanese soldiers injured in Israeli strike on watchtower - Xinhua
message:
BEIRUT, July 21 (Xinhua) -- Two Lebanese soldiers were injured on Sunday in an Israeli attack targeting a watchtower in the southwestern border region, according to the Lebanese military.
The Lebanese Army Command reported that the Israeli strike hit the army watchtower located outside the village of Alma al-Shaab.
Meanwhile, military sources told Xinhua anonymously that an Israeli Merkava tank fired a shell directly at the watchtower.
The Lebanese Army Command has requested the United Nations Interim Force in Lebanon (UNIFIL) to conduct a field investigation into the incident.
The Lebanese militant group also reported attacks on the Israeli Northern Corps command headquarters at Ein Zeitim base and on soldiers in Hanita, an Israeli kibbutz, with Katyusha rockets, resulting in casualties.

Yemen's Houthi rebels have promised a "huge" retaliation against Israel for a deadly strike on the port of Hodeida, as regional fallout widens from months of war in Gaza.
The Israeli strike, the first claimed by Israel in Yemen, set oil tanks ablaze at the vital port and came a day after the first fatal attack by the... read full story"aggravates the current tension in the region and halts the ongoing efforts to end the war in Gaza"

title: Israel orders evacuation of part of Gaza humanitarian zone
message:
Deir al-Balah, Jul 22 (AP) The Israeli military on Monday ordered the evacuation of part of an area in the Gaza Strip it has designated a humanitarian zone.
The area includes the eastern part of the Muwasi humanitarian zone, which is located in the southern Gaza Strip.
Israel has experienced a wave of stabbing attacks across the country during the nine-month war in Gaza.
The Israeli military said on Monday that it is continuing to operate in central and southern Gaza.
Netanyahu has vowed to wipe out Hamas' military and governing capabilities and secure the return of the remaining hostages.

Location: Gaza Strip
Target Event: Israel continues its operation in central and southern Gaza

title: 1 person dies in Mineral County officer - involved shooting
message:
FISH CREEK — One person died in an officer-involved shooting on Sunday morning in Mineral County.
The Mineral County Sheriff's Office reports the shooting happened at approximately 11 a.m. in the Fish Creek area.
The Montana Department of Criminal Investigations (DCI), Missoula County Sheriff's Office detectives, and a Missoula Police Department detective were called to process the scene.
DCI will submit reports to the Mineral County Attorney's Office once the investigation is complete.
Mineral County Sheriff Ryan Funke tells MTN that two officers are paid administrative leave pending an evaluation.
event_breakdown: Security Event 1: On Sunday, May 22, 2022, one person died in an officer-involved shooting in Fish Creek, Montana, in the Fish Creek area. The shooting happened around 11 a.m., and the Montana Department of Criminal Investigations (DCI) was then summoned to process the scene.

title: Ukrainian Civilians Wounded in Russian Drone and Shelling Attacks as Russia Claims gains in the East
message:
KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russian strikes wounded at least five people in Ukraine on Sunday, local officials said, as the two countries exchanged drone, missile and shelling attacks.
Three people were wounded by Russian drone strikes in southern Ukraine’s partly occupied Kherson region, local officials said Sunday morning.
In addition, Russia launched three ballistic missiles and two guided air missiles, which did not reach their targets, he said.
Russian air defense systems overnight destroyed eight drones over the country’s Belgorod region and over the Black Sea, the Russian Ministry of Defense said.

title: Pakistani police officer killed in Peshawar attack amid rising violence
message:
Pakistani media report that a police officer was killed in Peshawar following an attack by armed individuals.
According to Pakistani media, the attack occurred on Sunday, July 21, at the “Armored” checkpoint in central Peshawar.
Pakistani officials have confirmed that the victim was named Saeedullah and was targeted by a sniper.
Previously, following an increase in attacks and insecurity in various regions of Pakistan, including Khyber Pakhtunkhwa, Balochistan, and Peshawar, two soldiers were killed in a roadside mine explosion in North Waziristan.
According to reports, four protesters were killed, and 21 others were injured when the protests turned violent.

title: Yemen Houthi - held port of Hodeida still ablaze 2 days after Israeli strike
message:
Heavy flames and black smoke spiraled into the sky for a third consecutive day following the strike on Saturday, said an AFP correspondent in Hodeida.
Rescuers arrive at the scene of giant fire at an oil storage facility in Yemen's Houthi-held port city of Hodeida, following Israeli strikes, July 20, 2024.
AFP/GettyHigh-resolution satellite images taken by Maxar Technologies showed flames consuming a heavily damaged fuel storage area at the Hodeida harbor.
An analysis of satellite imagery by the Dutch peace organization PAX showed at least 33 destroyed oil storage tankers, said Wim Zwijnenburg, a project leader with the group.
Maxar closeup satellite imagery of the Yemeni port city of Hodeida shows smoke rising from oil storage tanks after Israeli airstrikes, July 20, 2024.

title: Houthi harbour still ablaze days after Israel strikes on Yemen
message:
July 22, 2024 — Hodeida (Yemen) (AFP)Firefighting teams on Monday struggled to contain a massive blaze at Yemen's rebel-held Hodeida port, days after a deadly Israeli strike damaged oil storage facilities and endangered aid ships in the harbour.
Firefighters appeared to have made little progress, with the blaze seemingly expanding in some parts of the port, the correspondent said, amid fears it could reach food storage facilities.
High-resolution satellite images taken by Maxar Technologies showed flames consuming a heavily damaged fuel storage area at the Hodeida harbour.
- 'Vital lifeline' -Yemeni port authorities said Hodeida "is operating at its full capacity", the rebels' Saba news agency reported.
The International Rescue Committee charity called the port "a vital lifeline for delivering humanitarian aid to Yemen."
event_breakdown:
Location: Hodeida (Yemen)
Firefighting teams on Monday struggled to contain a massive blaze at Yemen's rebel-held Hodeida port, days after a deadly Israeli strike damaged oil storage facilities and endangered aid ships in the harbour.

title: At least five killed in shooting at Croatia nursing home
message:
At least six people have been killed in a gun attack at a nursing home in Croatia.
FIve residents and one employee were dead after the gunman entered the private nursing home in eastern Croatia's Daruvar and went on a killing spree, according to police.
State broadcaster HRT said an unidentified gunman entered a nursing home in Daruvar - some 130km east of Zagreb - and began shooting.
Police said they were informed of the incident at 10.10am local time (9.10am Irish time), and confirmed the suspect had entered the nursing home and used a firearm.
Croatian newspaper Jutarnji list described the alleged shooter as a "retired military police officer" who killed his mother along with other residents and staff.
event_breakdown: Map showing the location of the event in eastern Croatia's Daruvar.

title: 20 - year - old arrested for stabbing in Sydney
message:
Sydney, July 22 : Australian police confirmed on Monday that a 20-year-old male suspect has been charged with a stabbing incident over the weekend.
Upon arrival, officers located a 45-year-old man suffering from stab wounds in his shoulder and back.
Following the incident, a crime scene was established with an investigation also launched into all circumstances of the stabbing.
He was refused bail to appear at Fairfield Local Court today," said the New South Wales Police Force (NSW).
Sunday's incident was the third alleged stabbing that occurred in Sydney during the recent weekend.
event_breakdown:
Sydney stabbing
Police have confirmed a 20-year-old male has been charged with a stabbing incident that occurred in Sydney, Australia on July 22.
Upon arrival, officers located a 45-year-old man who was stabbed in his shoulder and back.
A crime scene was set up and an investigation was launched into the circumstances of the stabbing.

title: Woman charged in connection with stabbing
message:
CHARLESTON, W.Va.- One person was arrested in connection with a stabbing that happened in Charleston on Saturday.
Titshina Carter is charged with malicious wounding in connection with that incident.
Charleston Police said officers responded to the 1500 block of Dorchester Road for a reported stabbing around 10:30 p.m.Investigators said two people were arguing when things escalated.
Officers said the victim and suspect knew one another.
The victim was taken to the hospital for treatment.

title: Saudi Arabia denies connection with Israel Yemen attacks
message:
Saudi Arabia denies connection with Israel's Yemen attacksIRNA - Islamic Republic News AgencyJul 21, 2024Tehran, IRNA -- Saudi Arabia has denied any connection with the Israeli regime's airstrikes on the Yemeni port city of Hudaydah that left at teat three people dead and 87 others injured.
Saudi Arabia had no connection or participation in the bombing of Hudaydah, Brigadier General Turki al-Maliki, spokesman of the Saudi Ministry of Defense was quoted by Al Jazeera as saying on Sunday morning.
The spokesman further said that his country would never allow the violation of its airspace by any one, with reference to whether Zionist warplanes attacked Yemen by breaching Saudi airspace.
Channel 14 of the Zionist regime had previously reported that the Tel Aviv had informed the United States and Saudi Arabia before carrying out the attacks on Yemen.
According to Israeli media 20 F-35 warplanes carrying hundreds of tons of explosives targeted the Hudaydah port that caused massive fire and destruction.

title: 30 - year - old man arrested for fatally stabbing mother in Kochi Prefecture
message:
Police in Sukumo, Kochi Prefecture, said Sunday they have arrested a 30-year-old unemployed man on suspicion of fatally stabbing his 62-year-old mother at their home.
According to police, Kyosuke Nakayama is accused of stabbing his mother Miwa with a knife at around 6:35 p.m. on Saturday, Kyodo News reported.
Nakayama told a neighbor what he had done and the neighbor called 119.
Police found Nakayama on a road near his house and arrested him on the spot.
A blood-stained knife and a iron bar were reportedly found in the house near the victim's body.
event_breakdown:
Saitama - A 33-year-old man was arrested in Sakura City, Saitama Prefect, for allegedly driving around neighborhoods and stealing cash and other property from parked cars.
Fukuoka - A man was arrested in Fukuoka City for stealing a bicycle. Police said the 41-year-old man admitted he stole the bicycle because he wanted to buy a new one.
Kanazawa - Police in Kanazawa City, Ishikawa Prefecture, have arrested a 50-year-old man after finding resin in his bag that they suspect was stolen from a construction site.
Fukuo - Police in Fukuo City, Fukuoka Prefecture, arrested a 43-year-old man who threatened a woman by wielding a knife. The suspect is accused of following and threatening a woman with a knife.
Kanazawa - A 26-year-old woman was arrested for stealing a wallet from a visitor to the National Museum of Modern Art, Tokyo.

title: Civilians killed and wounded as Russia claims gains in the east
message:
At least two people were killed in Ukrainian strikes on the partly Russian-occupied Donetsk region, Russian state media said, while Ukrainian officials said Russian strikes wounded at least five people.
Along the front line in the east, Russia said it had taken control of two villages, one in the Kharkiv region and one in the Luhansk region.
Three people were wounded by Russian drone strikes in southern Ukraine’s partly occupied Kherson region, local officials said on Sunday morning.
Russian air defence systems overnight destroyed eight drones over the country’s Belgorod region and over the Black Sea, the Russian Ministry of Defence said.
Russian air defence also shot down two long-range ballistic ATACMS missiles in the sky over the Kherson region heading for Russia-annexed Crimea, Russia-installed Kherson Governor Vladimir Saldo said.
event_breakdown:
Current events of security reported in text that can be placed on a map:

- In Donetsk region of Ukraine, Ukrainian strikes killed at least two people.
- Russian strikes in Donetsk region wounded at least five people, according to Ukrainian officials.
- Russia has reportedly taken control of two villages in the Kharkiv and Luhansk regions.
- Russian drone strikes injured three people in southern Ukraine's Kherson region.
- Russian air defence systems destroyed eight drones over Belgorod region and over the Black Sea.
- Russian air defence shot down two long-range ballistic ATACMS missiles over the Kherson region.

title: Ukrainian Drone Strike Ignites Fire at Russian Oil Refinery
message:
A fire caused by a Ukrainian drone strike on Russia's Black Sea Tuapse oil refinery has been put out, officials said on Monday.
The refinery, owned by oil major Rosneft, was damaged in the drone attack overnight, officials from the Krasnodar region said earlier.
(With inputs from agencies.)
event_breakdown: Ukraine's armed forces have said that they targeted the Tuapse oil refinery with drones, causing a fire. The fire has now been put out. The refinery is owned by Russia's Rosneft.

title: Terrorist killed in on going operation in J & K Rajouri – Indian Defence Research Wing
message:
Terrorist killed in on going operation in J&K’s Rajouri| BySOURCE: IANSAn unidentified terrorist was killed and a soldierinjured on Monday in an anti-terror operation in Jammu and Kashmir’s Rajouri district.
Parshotam Kumar was recently awarded Shaurya Chakra by the President for helping to kill a terrorist in the Kalakote area of Rajouri district.
Soldiers drawn from the elite Para Commandos and those trained in mountain warfare have been deployed in these districts to eradicate terrorism.
Terrorist attacks have registered a spurt in the otherwise peaceful Jammu division.
Six terrorist attacks have been reported in the Jammu division since June 9 this yearin which 12 security personnel have been martyred.

title: Israel orders evacuation , dozens of Gazans killed
message:
STORY: Israeli shelling and airstrikes killed dozens of Palestinians near Khan Younis, Gaza medics said on Monday (July 22), as many fled the damaged city.
That's after Israel issued new evacuation orders to some neighborhoods in southern Gaza in what it said were renewed attacks in those areas.
Medics said the Palestinians were killed by tank salvoes in some towns just east of Khan Younis, with the area also bombarded by air.
Outside of Khan Younis' Nasser hospital, prayers were held for victims of the strikes.
An Israeli military statement said the new evacuation orders were given due to renewed Palestinian militant attacks - including rockets launched from the targeted areas in eastern Khan Younis.
event_breakdown: Israeli shelling and airstrikes killed dozens of Palestinians near Khan Younis, Gaza medics said on Monday (July 22), as many fled the damaged city. Medics said the Palestinians were killed by tank salvoes in some towns just east of Khan Younis, with the area also bombarded by air.

title: Israel issues evacuation orders in southern Gaza , kills 16 Palestinians - World
message:
CAIRO/OCCUPIED JERUSALEM: Israeli strikes killed at least 16 Palestinians in eastern areas of Khan Younis, Gaza health officials said on Monday, shortly after Israel issued new orders to evacuate some neighbourhoods after what it said was renewed attacks from those zones.
Gaza officials say 90 Palestinians killed as Israel targets Hamas military chiefPalestinian health officials said at least 16 Palestinians were killed in Israeli tank shelling in Bani Suhaila town east of Khan Younis.
The evacuation orders did not include health institutions, Palestinians said.
The Palestinians, the United Nations, and international relief agencies have said that there is no safe place left in Gaza.
Earlier in July, dozens of Palestinians were killed in separate Israeli attacks in the Al-Mawasi humanitarian-designated areas.
event_breakdown: Israeli strikes killed at least 16 Palestinians in eastern areas of Khan Younis, Gaza

title: Israel - Hamas War day 290 : What is happening in Israel and Gaza ?
message:
(photo credit: MOHAMMED SALEM/REUTERS)The Hamas-run Gaza Health Ministry stated on Monday that the death toll in Gaza has reached 39,006 since the war started on October 7 of last year.
A further 89,818 have thus far been wounded in the conflict, the Gazan ministry added.
The number has not been independently verified, and the ministry does not differentiate between civilians and combatants in its toll.
The Hamas-run ministry has also been repeatedly criticized for distorting casualty figures.
In May, departing from Hamas’s reported figures, the UN halved the number of women and children it had previously reported had been killed thus far in the war.
event_breakdown: New Israeli airstrikes hit Gaza. These are the first airstrikes by Israel since the war started on October 7 of last year. Ashraf al-Qidra, spokesman for the Gaza Health Ministry, stated that Israeli airstrikes on Gaza City on Wednesday night wounded two people.

title: South Korea Boosts Border Propaganda Broadcasts After North Korea Flies More Trash Balloons
message:
SEOUL, South Korea — South Korea said Sunday it was bolstering its anti-Pyongyang propaganda broadcasts across the tense border with rival North Korea, after the North launched more trash-carrying balloons toward South Korea.
South Korea’s Joint Chiefs of Staff said the North Korean balloons were flying Sunday morning north of Seoul, the South Korean capital, after crossing the border.
“The North Korean military’s tension-escalating acts can result in causing critical consequences for it,” the South Korean Joint Chiefs of Staff said in a statement.
“The responsibility for this situation is entirely on North Korea’s government.”Details of the expansion of South Korea's loudspeaker operations were not immediately available.
North Korea has floated more than 2,000 balloons to drop waste paper, scraps of cloth, cigarette butts, waste batteries and even manure on South Korea, though they have so far caused no major damage in South Korea.
event_breakdown:
target event : reports a conflict on enemy balloons flooding south korea
North Korea’s military sent more balloons carrying trash toward South Korea on Sunday. The South Korean Joint Chiefs of Staff have said they are bolstering anti-Pyongyang broadcasts in response.

title: Russian Brigade Manages To Lose 200 % Of Its Personnel
message:
Russian Brigade Manages To Lose 200% Of Its Personnel 3 22.07.2024, 13:437,144The command is concealing the losses.
The commander of one of the motorized rifle platoons of the Russian Armed Forces said that the losses in his brigade are twice as high as its total strength.
“The staff strength of the Russian brigade is up to 6 thousand people.
The Russian army maintains its combat capability only by constantly replenishing its personnel.
And judging by the video, the Russian officer had some bad premonitions,” Butusov noted.
event_breakdown: The Russian invasion in Ukraine continues with reports of high losses on the Russian side. The situation on the ground and in the air is not easy, even if one can not say for sure the side of the Ukrainian army, which may show higher losses. The Russian side seems to have raised twice as many soldiers as needed to maintain the combat capability of the Russian army. Russia's inability to organize and properly supply its army may contribute significantly to the high losses suffered by Russians in Ukraine. The situation is compounded by the fact that the Russians constantly bring new, untrained soldiers to the front and will not raise a professional army for a long time to come. The situation is extremely frustrating, even if it seems that Ukraine may have enough supplies to prevent further advances by the Russian army in the northeast. At the same time, there is despair in the western part of the country, where Russian air raids continue.

title: Villager , Soldier Injured As Terrorists Strike In J & K Rajouri
message:
JAMMU, July 22: The terrorists on Monday attacked the house of a Village Defence Guard (VDG) member, which was foiled by the Army troops in Gundah Village of tehsil Budhal in Rajouri district of Jammu and Kashmir, officials said.
Follow the Daily Excelsior channel on WhatsAppIn exchange of firing around 3.10 am, a relative of a VDG member and Shaurya Chakra awardee Parshotam Kumar and an Army soldier were injured, an official said.
“The terrorists had intentionally attacked the house of the VDG member,” sources said, adding that the Army successfully thwarted it.
“The area is cordoned off and 3 to 4 terrorists are believed to be trapped in the ensuing combat operation,” officials said.
The Army is launching “Operation All Out” with additional deployment of 3,000 troops and 500 para commandos to flush out foreign terrorists active in the hilly district of the Jammu region.
location: Gundah Village in Rajouri district Jammu and Kashmir
event_breakdown:
Event 1: Terrorists attacked the jg Mobile Crusher
Event 2: Army thwarted a terror attempt in Jammu
